text:
The auntie told me the price is $4 plus. When I ask for paynow, the price suddenly went up to $5.

Cos their minimum charge for paynow is $5.

Dishonest shop owner.
scam don't ever come here goods are expired and they swap the bread tags prices are also way above average for a neighbourhood convenience store so if u happen to come by just continue walking

$2 for a 500ml Pepsi, reason given by the uncle.... GST went up...ðŸ¤£
Well, I guess inflation is really bad.
When neighbourhood conveniece store become a 7 Eleven.

The shop dared to sell expired goods and spoilt products to people. They also use harassing tactics (e.g. pressuring people to buy until they buy it) to attempt to sell their products. They also never display the price tag of items so they can technically trick you to spend more. They buy their products at a discounted deal from Fairprice and sell it separately for a much higher price. Overall I do not recommend anyone to patronize this shop! Why couldn't the government send some SFA officers to regularly check on their products??

Poor service. The shopkeeper will be on his phone while serving you, and most of his attention would be on the phone instead of you. Expect his service to be very slow, and if asked for plastic bag, he'll give it to you and expect you to bag your items yourself. The whole time you're there waiting for him to serve you, you'll feel as if you're secondary while his phone call is his primary concern. I would rather walk to the NTUC at hougang or buangkok than to buy from him even though he is nearer. Poor.

Read the other reviews and you'll know this shop is horrible. Hope they close down and haomart will come back.
